questiontext.text: When measuring the backbone dihedral angles of a residue in a β-sheet, what is the typical phi (φ) angle?

generalfeedback.text: The phi (φ) angle in protein structures is one of the two main backbone dihedral angles. In β-sheets, this angle adopts a characteristic value that can be measured using PyMOL's measurement tools. Understanding these angles is crucial for analyzing protein secondary structure.

feedback.text: This value is incorrect for β-sheets. +60° is not commonly observed in protein secondary structures.
While -60° is a common phi angle in α-helices, it's not the typical value for β-sheets.
Correct! The phi angle in β-sheets is typically around -120°. This can be verified by measuring the dihedral angle in PyMOL.
This value has the wrong sign. β-sheets typically have a phi angle of -120°, not +120°.

questiontext.text: What is the typical psi (ψ) angle for residues in a β-sheet?

generalfeedback.text: The psi (ψ) angle is the second main backbone dihedral angle in protein structures. In β-sheets, this angle has a characteristic value that helps maintain the extended conformation of the strands.

feedback.text: This value is not typical for β-sheets. -60° is more commonly associated with other secondary structures.
While +60° is observed in some protein structures, it's not the characteristic psi angle for β-sheets.
This value is incorrect. β-sheets typically have a positive psi angle, not negative.
Correct! The psi angle in β-sheets is typically around +135°, which helps create the characteristic extended conformation.

questiontext.text: What does the PyMOL command "util.color_chains" do?

generalfeedback.text: PyMOL provides various utilities for coloring molecular structures. Understanding these commands is essential for creating clear and informative visualizations.

answer.text: Colors all amino acids the same

feedback.text: This is incorrect. This command actually assigns different colors to different chains, not the same color to all amino acids.

answer.text: Assigns different colors to different protein chains

feedback.text: Correct! This command automatically assigns different colors to different chains in the protein structure, making it easier to distinguish between them.

answer.text: Makes the entire protein rainbow colored

feedback.text: This is incorrect. Rainbow coloring is achieved using different commands like "spectrum". util.color_chains assigns different colors to different chains.
This is incorrect. Coloring by secondary structure uses different commands. util.color_chains specifically colors different chains differently.

questiontext.text: In an α-helix, what is the typical phi (φ) angle?

generalfeedback.text: The phi angle is one of the two main backbone dihedral angles that define protein secondary structure. In α-helices, this angle adopts a characteristic value that can be measured using PyMOL's measurement tools.

feedback.text: Correct! The phi angle in α-helices is typically around -60°. This value helps create the characteristic helical shape.
This value has the wrong sign. α-helices typically have a phi angle of -60°, not +60°.
This value is more typical for β-sheets. α-helices have a phi angle closer to -60°.
This value is incorrect for α-helices. The typical phi angle is -60°.
